intro: Drimia polyantha, commonly known as the Cape bell or white bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its long, strap-like leaves and striking white flowers that resemble bells. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance and ability to bloom reliably. Drimia polyantha is also valued in traditional medicine for its various therapeutic properties.
